PAbF-POt8oudC3LaD-qsGw.text: Really like this place. I used to work in the area and it was a great place to get lunch or hit up happy hour. The Shepherd's Pie is great! All the food is good. They also serve Guinness the "right way" True pour I guess it's called. Great band nights, and great overall atmosphere.

ORVaYTzyLK6vzR5yfC7Rfw.text: I arrived for lunch today just after noon.  I figured i'll maybe stare at some football and enjoy some bar grub.  There were maybe 4-5 customers total. I have a seat and giggle to myself about two flagpoles positioned directly in front of the TV with the game on.  I decide I don't care enough about that game anyway and i'll just focus on lunch.  The waitress and bartender were both friendly and greeted me on the way in.  A menu was provided quickly and drink order taken.  The tables are VERY sticky.  Sticky as in they have been sticky for so long no amount of scrubbing will get that sort of sticky out.  Anyway, I decide to order the sampler appetizer. Wings, onion rings, cheesy sticks and eggrolls to name a few.  It's a good size platter for about $14. A fair price for sure.  In less than 10 minutes the food is at my table.  This is great except three of the six items on my plate are barely warm.  Barely.  Like, how does a food order in an empty restaurant arrive not hot out of the kitchen? I take one bite of two different items before feeling the rest with my hand and calling the waitress over.  I explain half my plate is not hot.  She apologizes and brings it back to the kitchen.  Immediately comes back to my table to explain someone is training in the kitchen and the chef was not here however the chef did JUST arrive.  She apologizes and I say I understand and thank you.  In literally less than 3 minutes she returned with the exact same tray including the two items that I had taken a bite from.  Everything is now hot which is fine but the only way this could happen if if they simply threw the food in the microwave and sent it back out.  She comes back and asks if everything is ok.  I say "did they literally just toss this in the microwave and bring it right back out, because how else would all of this have been made in a couple minutes, the items I tasted are still on this place and now the texture is rubbery"  She apologized and said she didn't know what they did.  She asked if I would like them to make me another appetizer platter.  I told her no thanks, i'm good.  I say "Thank you for trying but I don't have all day for them to get pub food right".  I I'm just going to leave, no need in playing this back and forth game and i'm not here to make a scene. I wished them a good day and left.  Pretty sad that I was the only customer getting food at that point and two trips to the kitchen and all they did was microwave my food.  Gross.  I know better than to expect a good meal on the third time sending it back to a kitchen.  I'll stick to Rula Bula or hell even Seamus downtown before I return to Rosie's.

BQgAfVXXM3dAVTL5Yakf0w.text: Big fan of this place. The snakebite is my go-to drink! The fish & chips are fabulous. I'd definitely recommend ordering at the bar though. The bartenders are usually friendlier than the wait staff.

PYmjYFMLvWYz1n_HfTKKkA.text: I always hate giving bad reviews, but our service left quite a bit to be desired. I can normally dismiss such things, but it became evident that our bad service was not a fluke.  We arrived around 10:00 and was told that food would only be served until 11. That wouldn't be a problem at all except that our waitress didn't return with menus until close to 10:30 and then returned to take our orders at only a few minutes before 11. The place had other patrons, but it certainly wasn't so busy as to take an hour to get our orders. Unfortunately, on each of our visits, the waitress was half listening and seemed easily confused  The food itself was quite good. The Shepherd's pie was hot and tasty and the bloody marys were actually perfectly spiced. Neither was worth getting excited about, but they were certainly decent and reasonably priced.   Considerably later in the evening, our waitress returned with the bill. There was one extra drink on the bill which no one ordered and she was perfectly friendly about saying she'd remove it, but we spent a good five minutes as she kept getting confused about our - apparently - very complicated instructions of "$20 on the credit card. The rest in cash" She continually read back excessively complex scenarios, and we kept asking her simply to put twenty on the card, that's all.  When she returned, she had taken $20 of our cash towards the bill, charged $60 to the card and kept the remaining $55 in cash as a tip. That's just shy of a 75% tip she assigned herself.   We spoke to the manager, who couldn't find her for some time, and when she showed up, she blamed us repeatedly. She finally refunded the card and brought us our new bill, with the extra drink.  It wasn't worth arguing about at that point.  The sad part is that everyone at my table, and our surrounding tables started telling similar tales from past visits. I guess this kind of service is not uncommon.

oAGO2c3KQXU0elu5MjkLHQ.text: Great staff that are very nice. The food was remarkable as were the drinks. A great place to regularly visit.

MR6eXXyXkyRIJ1JvAGw0_w.text: My husband and I dined here this evening at about 7:30 for dinner. I had high hopes for this place. It looks fun from the outside. I was impressed when I read somewhere that Mr McCaffrey introduced Guinness to Phoenix. Since the owners are from Ireland, I was anticipating an authentic Irish experience here.  Well, our first impression was, shall I say, odd. We walked in the main entrance and were greeted by...nobody. The place looked empty at first, and we wondered if we had come through the wrong door. We walked around trying to figure out where we were supposed to be, got funny looks from people at the bar, then returned from whence we came, only to discover a small sign instructing us to seat ourselves. Whoops!  We chose a booth and wondered how anyone would know we were there. After a bit (maybe 5 minutes?) a very nice waitress greeted us saying "I didn't see you guys all the way over here!" She took our drink order (water - we're easy to please in that regard) and swiftly returned with our beverages. The swiftness did not continue, however.  We probably sat there about 15 or 20 minutes waiting to give our waitress our orders. Mind you, the HUGE place was near empty. When she finally returned to us, she asked us if we were okay, and apologized, saying she had forgotten about us.  The ambiance was nice and Irish-like. However, I will say that I wished they had chosen Irish music to play over the stereo, rather than assorted genres of 90s American music. Weird.  Now onto the food. They didn't seem to have much on the menu that seemed very authentically Irish. Maybe the Irish don't have much variety in their food? At any rate, I had the corned beef and cabbage, and my other half had the shepherd's pie. Both were good, but not as good as I had hoped for. Fresh ingredients would have made a big difference. Also, it was disappointing that there was ground beef, not sheep, in the shepherd's pie.  Overall, this place was just okay, and we both agreed that we wouldn't desire to return there.

SGqoQYwTwSHcltciCnl3GA.text: Can a place be judged by one appetizer - I say yes. Do not order their Potato cakes or Potato pellets (can't recall official name, but it's on the App menu). Yes, I knew these things were going to be deep fried, but how lazy is the freakin kitchen in this place? They dump these frozen crappy things into a fryer and serve it up with good ole' ranch to cover the taste. Do I now have to ask specifically about everything on every menu to make sure I'm not getting ripped off - apparently yes. The menu description says potatoes and green chiles and other spices rolled together, etc. How hard is it to take some of your fresh mashed stuff, roll it up , etc and deep fry it? Nah, these guys aren't interested in serving quality food, so we get a cowdung sized pellet filled with fake potatoes and having no taste. Pathetic.    Happy Hour drinks are a joke as well. They were only $2.75 for well drinks, but the 2 drinks I had and the 2 drinks she had were all water, no booze.  Plus, the blonde bartender had no clue how to change the TV stations. It was funny watching her try to change channel old school style on the set. The manager rescued her later with the remote..lol.

d4b36y7l6tye36PcuTsPiA.text: Food is good.. Service is so so (to be expected on a Friday night...)  The reason for the one star is the server delivered the incorrect bill for our table.  While the waitress corrected the bill she billed my credit card for both the correct and incorrect amounts!!   My advice.. double check your dinner bill at this place..  Message to management:  Take the beef ribs off your menu.  The multiple times I've been there you're always "out."

V5i4lYsyEyGCIN7OdRUPxA.text: I'm a fan.  Not the best place for drink specials or a good price on a beer, so that would prevent me from making this a regular spot, but I'll be back here and there.  It's got a nice place and feel inside, but the bottom line is the $, and that is what gives it a 3*.  For the mark up on alcohol...come on man, do you value your customers or not?

DEJy3yAdelL1Zp8kDLI4ZA.text: We had a Groupon for two visits to this restaurant.  It is not good!  The first time we thought the atmosphere was terrible but the food (fish) was OK  There were only a few people there - a couple of cronies of the bartenders at the bar and a couple of other people besides us.  Last week we went a second time since we still had the Groupon.  (Otherwise we would not have gone back.)  It was horrible!  The food was barely edible - lukewarm corned beef, dry meatloaf, lumpy mashed potatoes, bitter vegetables, etc.  Even worse than the food was the BLARING Irish music.  There were a few more people this time - probably about 15 people in all.  The decor is old and tacky and the ladies bathroom smelled like a sewer.  UGH!  Save your money and go somewhere else.

XJdfbIglIQ4ZkVFCEVM0cQ.text: I absolutely love this place. Been going here for 3 years Atleast and have never had a bad night with service. Food is always great, the staff is great and the drinks are amazing. Live music is always on point. What more can you ask for??? Oi oi oi oi oi

TLgI-bcTdbWT4PLy0Ku4bw.text: I love Rosie's... it's definitely the go-to Irish pub. I like its central location, atmosphere, prices, music, drink selection, staff, and best of all their outdoor patio.

i2W0SUc_w__6l1jkP4jGbg.text: This is in my 'hood, yo!  I come for the fish n chips.  Nothing more, nothing less.  I always have a great server and I can't remember her name but she has about 6 kids or something like that. My apartment building is close, so my neighbors also frequent Rosie's.  I seriously need to get there sometime for the music!

5BaBclHFhBVmPTcjVsyY0A.text: Rosie advertises their award for the "BEST" fish and chips in Phoenix. I really hope that is not the best Phoenix has to offer, otherwise I will forego this meal until I can get out of town.  We had the "famous" fish and chips last night and it was "TERRIBLE".  First the breading was so tough that it almost needed a knife to cut through it.  The fish itself, OMG, it had been frozen so long that it quickly turned mushy in our mouths. Never, never again.  The rest of the meal was fine.  We had no complaints with the coleslaw, french fries, or tartar sauce.  It was also nice that they provided malt vinegar. I just hope some of their other food is better, as Rosie's is a good representation of an Irish Pub.

Tfg4QgneP5hj6BDFmSRu7g.text: The meatloaf sandwich is astounding.  Not a bad little Irish bar, but some of the food is incredible.

ZPMRJrn2M6KTXrBs-Ceyvg.text: We absolutely loved this place!  From the Irish music, Irish beers, delicious food, to the friendly staff!  The Mac and cheese was out of this world!  And the ham and cheese was awesome!  If ever in phoenix again, will definitely go back!!

nCGs9WMW3DjCoPQP1-2qOQ.text: I used to live within almost walking distance. I'm sorry to say that it's not that cool. One thing I'd agree with Jon K with is that I rarely saw any women in here. It does draw in huge groups of guys. They do have a great beer and liquor selection. But it's pricey as hell. The bartenders are mostly friendly and attentive.  The parking lot here is a mess. Take the number of patrons inside and multiply it by 1.4, and that's the number of cars. It might be easier to park on 8th Place as it gets packed. They have a few TV's but they're riddled with static. How is it a place like this charges five bucks for a fucking beer but can't fix their satellite, or just get Cox cable? I know it's not a sports bar, but it's typically so boring that the TV thing becomes important.  I'd say skip this place and check out the Vig, Shadys, Sanctum, HB Hanrattys, Pomeroys or any of the places on 16th Street. Hell, even hit up a gay bar. You'll save yourself money and have a much better chance of seeing a woman.

h_Grkr809hbAH9oS2Ofm-w.text: Love this place. I work right down the street amd Rosies became a usual for lunch for everyone here. With the amazing linch specials we could never go wrong. Sam was always so bright and cheery and knew us all by names or pet names if you were special ;) Keep up the great work.

w-Yzq4kfAimpdhzViV6SQA.text: I went there for the first time last night for beers after a long weekend and our waitress was simply not attentive. She seemed rushed and didn't even smile. She forgot my beer and didn't offer to split up a six person tab.   Luckily the chicken wings and beer made up for the awful service. Classic Irish Pub!  We also got to sit right next to Rosie!

DOEdZAhIxgp2Y4BNYtiyzA.text: I do like Rosie's and thank god they got some decent bartenders in there on Saturday night now. The two beeyotches who worked there forever and never cracked a smile needed to go! Much better! The waitresses are always sweet. Some great bands (like RIG) play at Rosie's. The crowd is usually pretty friendly....it is everything you would expect from a neighborhood Irish pub...

h3LviI6z0l_WRysK3zKiHQ.text: Nicky and Mitzy took great care of us...a group of ten old college buddies. The food was great especially the wings and the service excellent. Thanks for a great time! The U of A Pikes thankyou

mxx85FaD7FtxvViUWQInmw.text: We have tried repeatedly to get on their web site and it never loads. On our last visit I asked about this and staff seemed dumbfounded. It should open they said. There's nothing wrong they said. Still won't open.   Okay now my review.  The place used to be a happening place. Any day of the week it would be busy and the food outstanding. Now the place is like a morgue. There's hardly any one there. The music is still good, but the food has gone downhill.  It isn't the quality I've come to expect from Rosie's. I drink a beer they don't have on tap and it comes in a bottle. It is not as cold as I like it and I'm no longer offered a chilled glass. Wait staff is still friendly but Rosie's has just gone way down hill. On a Saturday night when we stopped by it was empty. Wait staff playing around lip syncing and dancing to the bar music because there were only three other people in the place besides us. What in the world has happened to one of my favorite places?

1RvYPW2SjwIzLx1Rz21OWw.text: This place let itself down badly tonight. I was at the bar with my girlfriend and her friend enjoying drinks. I went to the toilet and witnessed a Patron violently vomiting his guts up in the stall and screaming bloody murder as he did it. I went and told a bartender / member of staff that he probably should be removed.  To my disgust I see a server / bar-back guy  go get the fella who was vomiting and escort his back to his seat at the bar to continue drinking while he was clearly hammered and could barely walk.  Absolutely disgusting. Tabbed our and left straight away and I'm guessing the toilet was painted with his insides.  Neither bartender seemed to care that he was a full blown disgrace at 9pm on a Friday .

LOzTv4E1t1SoNrEN0Lfa4Q.text: Just left and got home. I am trying to be professional and not just freak or scream but now I remember why we stopped coming here.  Forget all the other stuff.  Need a refill and the bartender has a friend show up?    Ha Ha Ha.  Too bad. 10 minutes after setting the empty pints on the bar's  edge, looking around, trying to wave her down and not once - never did the bartender look up, check the folks at the bar, or stop talking and visiting with her friend long enough to make her rounds. (2 customers got up and went to the restroom and returned and not a once did she or anyone bother to check us at the bar - any of us at the bar).  Then I made the mistake (I take part of the blame) for ordering food that was not fresh cooked.  My husband ordered fish and chips (you have to make that fresh) and they came out fresh and crisy. He was quite happy with the fish. The chips were warm(ish) and not crispy.  I stupidly ordered Shepard's pie. It was cold. Not quite ice crystals but just at the frozen stage when it came out.    Remember the bartender and her friend?  Another 10 minutes - 15 minutes(?) before I catch the eye of another server by standing on the barstool cross pieces and waving and calling out before she comes over.   I tell her it's cold. She says we'll heat that up. 10 minutes go by. I wave and call out again if there is any chance of getting my food?  She disappears into the kitchen.  Comes back to tell me they are making me a new one.  My husband (by this time) is 3/4 of the way done with his food. I have not had anything. And yes of course I can here to sit and watch someone eat and not eat with them. Isn't that what everyone does?  So the server who actually came over to "fix" the food issue goes outside. I assume on a break or to smoke or something.  10 minutes goes by.  She finally comes in and heads straight into the kitchen. I said to my husband "my foods probably been sitting there the entire time".  She comes out carrying food for me.  It is the same plate, the same food, the same everything I sent back (except the bread on the side is hard as a rock from going through the salamander again)  but now it has a pound of cheese melted on top.  It is barely warm. I get it to go and 60+ dollar later we've had beer, 1 meal, a crappy time and I am at the either cry or yell stage. Now I remember why we do not go here anymore.  You want an Irish pub with good food and SERVICE?  Go to Tim Finnegans.

2CwlmEiuVUS48qt8WN0H7w.text: Always love Rosie's, we like to go Friday nights when there's a good band playing. Great selection of Irish whiskeys and always cold Guinness on tap. The Reuben burger is absolutely amazing!! I get it without the bun and it's delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bunless Reuben burger

Y8lW6dAfC_CoqO0cIGEwNw.text: Had such a fun time here for Trivia Night with a large group of friends. Funny thing is that the rules say you may not have your cell phone in hand before your team turns in each answer as if text message previews don't exist. lol One particular team did not eat or drink throughout the entire game and yet interestingly, at least one person in said group still needed to use the restroom AFTER each question was read and it was time to discuss. Pretty hilarious! What adults feel the need to be Trivia Night champions sooo badly that someone is sent to the restroom each time to text the correct answers over??  Honestly really sad and awkward but something we were all able to laugh about afterwards. Otherwise it was a really great time, most people in attendance seemed to be enjoying themselves, our food was tasty and servers were nice! Overall a fun evening and we will be back!

8yaf-h31xntky6s-4gpaXg.text: I enjoy this one along with the original downtown. If I'm in the area and in the mood for a Guinness this is a great place to be. The decor alone is worth a visit as the bar is a True Irish pub bar.   Seamus (I believe the owner)... on this particular stop was watching a futbol game when we arrived. He let us know he was open but not serving booze yet, but that he was making a exception for us. Made us feel even more welcomed.   I opted for a bloody mary instead of my go to Guinness and was presently surprised as he made it with Clamato juice. Hit the spot.   If you want to feel welcomed like you're in a True Irish pub being treated like a friend, this is the place for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mcjAhy5il0UTZNnunHZgNA.text: Rosie's has been a go to place for the St. Patrick's Day party, however it is a solid contender for good fish and chips and karaoke. Wednesday night karaoke after 9 PM is always a good time capped off with excellent battered cod and crispy fries. Oh! Don't let me forget that they know how to pour a perfect black and tan. I want to see that distinct dark and light beer.

1g3AZehCAGM3eh7IUgDWDw.text: Stopped in for a nightcap the other night and had a great time! The bartender was awesome and the drinks were great. I liked the atmosphere too! Looks like there's an apartment above the bar! Didn't eat this time but will be back soon to check the menu out

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love Carlsberg on tap!
Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. What the hell??
Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Someone&#39;s apartment above the bar?

XMAEgKK8CgGrsZHlErRcEA.text: Misty is a fantastic server. We felt super comfortable and she was very knowledgeable on food and drinks which is super helpful! I would love to have servers like Misty where-ever we go! She's terrific! Food was great and drinks were very good as well. We love this place and look forward to coming back many more times in the future!

OeNGJeuXkfY2TIcZOJArOA.text: I stopped in here for a quick bite and beer on a Sunday afternoon.  The bartenders were awesome and the fish-n-chips, bountiful.  The space is comfortable and dark, as an Irish Pub should be; at least in my opinion.  I wish I would have taken a picture of the fish-n-chips before I posted this review.  It was a big portion!

Gx5mvFfeh6r0jA6i2wRogg.text: It's an awesome pub. Sit at the bar, patio or high back wooden tables. The food was great, prices reasonable and the staff was very attentive. A nice selection of Irish and English drafts to compliment whatever Irish meal you partake. We attended lunch on a Sunday afternoon and the crowd was minimal. The place was clean with good music overhead.

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Main Entrance
Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside
Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smithwick Red Ale ( Irish)--Great with the Fish &amp; Chips, light body with smooth taste. (No bitterness at all)

wwwH-ZmVXd3C7nqv4Nyu-w.text: Rosie's is that neighborhood bar that you want in your neighborhood--neither too packed nor too empty, a standard full bar with some fun and unique drinks, good eats when you need them, unpretentious and friendly staff, and, of course karaoke.

zaxcJVtTxAMvb-n6OfiecA.text: Best fish and chips in town! Excellently poured pints. Friendly staff. Dark and cozy. It's a pub. A really good pub. You either get it or you don't.

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jenny pours a perfect pint every time.

wRqPJb3Ga1jLp2T0jxNfaA.text: I love this place. Come mostly on Wednesday for the amazing karaoke. Phil is legit. Idk how Marcy adequately makes drinks for that many people as I never have to wait to quence my thirst. Much love!

u97izkehNM7eH1_IrwdBtg.text: Always hands down the best time in Phoenix! It bit off the path but worth it for real food and drink. This place always has something going on and service is always in point.

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy

tHOdz28kyXft0dZh2_6gOQ.text: I like this Irish bar, fun to come and watch a game or to just relax and enjoy a drink. The bar is old and has a great relaxing feel to it. I haven't had much food but the breakfast was good but it was just eggs and bacon and potatoes. It's a fun St Patty's day place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Irish cider, I&#39;m not a beer fan but I love a good cider.

waTGuEcCzb1nVkw8qqR7qw.text: Great Sunday Bloody Mary 's and Irish  Breakfast! Plus the entertainment was the Best for a Sunday Morning at 11 Am . Will be back soon .

IpHWyQnZNGraJoQXTO6wEA.text: Cool atmosphere but the food was lack luster. We ordered a couple appetizers including the prime rib sliders but their meats were flavorless and just draped over the bread with no flare. The rest of the food was the same, sounding good in the descriptions but presented like you would expect fast food to look different from the pics on the menu. Would come back to hang out and drink but I would not eat here again or suggest it to people looking for good food.

JalfBC2Y2Zr7wH70hhrskg.text: Always wanted to come in and we finally took a chance on it and it was worth it! Service was really nice and friendly and food was great! Our waitress was really friendly as well.

gKH6uO5Yt_PwxG28aXQGDw.text: This place is banging!  A group of us from work decided to head here Friday night to celebrate something. What it was evades me, and probably isn't that important. What matters is we were able to take over the upstairs balcony, have good service and drink like we were back in college.   The times I've eaten here before, it's always been very good. I did not eat last night; rather, I imbibed quite liberally. Three Guinnesses and two Irish Car Bombs later, I was pleasantly relaxed and had to kick it. I was glad I hadn't driven because parking is at a premium. That and the whole drinking and driving thing is so 1988. Buzzed walking is tubular!

A1QQSZi6elhcH3yC9fuQ7w.text: Who would have guessed that Phoenix has one of the best Irish pubs around? Listening to Vinyl Station Band on a Thurs wondering why isn't this place packed to the gills??   Amazing live music (two bearded guys on guitar, both sing and play harmonica, one plays bass drum at same time too). Best covers and original songs we've heard.  Seriously--someone should sign these guys! No cover! Great wings (get the hot).  Super authentic pub.

ItVZZ0raQJPgU_uOoNfETg.text: The Sheppard's pie...awesome. Good selection of Irish beer and whiskey. Friendly staff. I will be back.

sziODQTQjNt3UckyYBX0oA.text: Waitress never checked on us once after she brought our food to the table. Didn't see her the entire time we ate. About 30 minutes. She only came back to clear our plates and bring our bill.  Meatloaf was disgusting and full of rock hard bits.

D5Pc3Cp2BZpyzOtS8P070A.text: Avoid! Visited for the first time recently, pretty cool place almost! Waitress explained it was happy hour and appetizers were half off and drinks were also discounted. So we ordered apps and drinks. When the bill came there was no discount applied so we mentioned it to another server. We were then told they messed up, and that they had given us incorrect information. Understandable of course, except then we were told there was nothing they could do and we would have to pay full price. (!) No apology, not shit. We will never come back! (Which is a bummer because we wanted to like this place). Respect your self and go elsewhere.

z_NwgbTzSQKLZ8pp3aJxeg.text: Love the Dirty Leprechaun it's a must have house shot. It's an excellent atmosphere I will definitely come back. The band plays at a level where you can still socialize while enjoying the music. Next time I will try the food.

QCla-lsiED4j41ducuOJFw.text: I came here for lunch on Saturday, and was happy with what I had experienced.  Upon entering, I was seated in the front with my guest, and we were greeted by our server.  I did not get a chance to walk around the place to observe it, but I have to say, the service was amazing.  We had a wonderful lady who was probably old enough to be our mom waiting on us.  (thats complimentary.)  She was genuine, kind, and was one of a kind.    I ended up ordering the tuna melt, and could not decide what kind of bread to get.  I asked our server, and she had suggested sourdough, because she said that I would get a bigger sandwich.  Sold!  I enjoyed this place, even though it has more of a bar feel.  its reasonably easy to spot from the road, and our service was excellent.  I would gladly return for lunch or dinner to this place.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, is becuase  the interior is somewhat dark, and its more of a bar feel then a resturant feel.  I would see myself going here for a night out for drinks, but the food here was good, and service made it even better.

iEvY45y51t_rlydM38IU3Q.text: "This is an Irish bar," was all they would tell me. "Do you have mojitos?" Waitress' response, "absolutely not, this is an Irish bar." Me,  "Can I get a margarita?" Response, "We just have your standard marg mix and tequila, after all, this is just an Irish bar." Oh, I see...  Sometimes beer just isn't cold enough in freakin', steamin' hot Arizona and you just NEED a beverage with ice cubes.   I ended up getting a "irish" drink, beer on tap... but I still NEEDED ice cubes. ICE- water please? Waitress was very reluctant to provide delicious ICE water it seemed.... But to give her the benefit of the doubt, it was Friday during happy hour and I was there with a group of about twelve and you don't get tipped much for serving water.  BUT parking is also a mess (besides the lack of mojitos and margs).  Their dinky lil parking lot fills up super quick and thirsty patrons are left to their own devices to find parking on neighborhood side streets that won't tow their car. I was fortunate to find parking close by :)  I did like this place because its a great place to socialize with friends... hopefully everyone in the group is kosher with drinking beer.

d4DL-nDb0FoltUTez3TH9w.text: Sadly enough, Rosie McCaffrey's is like my Cheers --- not because it's so great, but because I can walk there, they know what my drink is, I can get schnookered and follow the breadcrumbs back to my house.  Come to think of it though, there are people there who resemble Norm, Sam and Woody.  The crowd is all over the map depending on the day of week.  A friend of mine sardonically describes it as a straight version of Padlock --which if you know what that means then great.  But if not, it's better that way -- trust me.  Let's just say it can be a bit of a meet market.   Weekends are crowded and tend to attract a fun upper-20s, early-30s party-hearty crowd -- the Tempe crowd 7 years later, I suppose.  It attracts more of a mainstream crowd than say George and Dragon.   Bands perform on the weekends.  But to be honest I can't even tell you what kind of music or what they sing.  They have a lot of beers on tap (Harp, Guinness and such) and strong liquor pours.  Tom is a rockin bartender. Weekdays are more laidback with a steady happy hour clientele of alcoholics, business crowd, Central Phoenix locals, Irish expatriates and rugby people. The jukebox is OK, but there are better jukeboxes in the area.  The feel inside is your standard Irish chotchky clutter, but it feels like an actual old house with the whole upper level.    Oh yes, and the pub grub is pretty good.  The fish and chips here are deserving of their reputation.  Great batter. The hot wings are also a good choice -- lots of meat and tasty Harp-soaked sauce. Stay away from the club sandwich -- the bread is soggy and the American cheese kind of ruins it.   BTW, St. Patty's day is CRAZY here. Yeah there are Irish pubs everywhere, but this is the only Irish pub for miles around -- so the crowd here was huge and spilled into the parking lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zPA4ijC1P6_mUZmlzAEtSg.text: A True Irish Pub - you just might meet Rosie herself. Great ambience - like being in Ireland. Fish & chips are perfect - like being in Ireland. Irish stew is great - like being in Ireland. And the Guinness - not quite like Ireland, but it's as close as you get in the U.S. (nothing tops the Guinness you get in Ireland!!) Limited wine selection which was a disappointment for those of us who are not beer drinkers (I know, I know - Irish pubs aren't supposed to be known by their selection of fine wine!) Something on the menu for everyone; live music on the weekend.

FVAEL9KUpw03810elhsmmg.text: If you like warm beer, bad service and over-priced food in a less then sterile environment go to Mccaffreys

zvBgCmAhJ9rqMv7zKHNzlA.text: Tasty food, friendly staff, fun atmosphere to watch soccer. The lamb stew, wings, and pastrami reuben were all deeelish. Be forewarned, the hot wings are no joke.

_52t8vuOaY8F62aQVaYLyw.text: We planned a happy hour here this past Fri night.  I had heard good things so I was really looking forward to some fun with good friends and good beer.  Unfortunately, I was drastically disappointed.  The service was absolutely terrible.   The question of "What do you have on tap?" should not be a difficult one to answer.  Our server didnt feel like answering and instead pointed to the menus with attitude as if we were making her night miserable.   Strike One.  Our group quickly turned from 4 to 8.  When we turned to our server to assist us in relocating to a larger table, she told us we could look around if we wanted to, but she didnt think it was possible to accomodate a party of 8.  We asked about the upstairs and she told us there was a private party and no room.   A friend of mine went up anyways, to see a perfectly open table with 8 lovely chairs.  He asked the private party, which was paying the check and getting ready to leave, if they minded we sit at the other table.  Of course, they didnt care at all and we moved ourselves. Strike Two.  Despite the bad attitude and completely unaccomodating service, we managed to rack up quite a bill between all of us.  I waited tables for four years and consider it a given with such a large party and hefty bill to offer separate checks.  Before we could even ask, the SINGLE check was dropped with 18% Gratuity added to it.        Stike Three.  The food was average at best.  I've had better Potato Skins at TGI Fridays.  Its a shame, because this place is a $5 cab ride from my home and I really wanted to like it.    I will make the drive to Rula Bula over this place any day.

MJrWYJe09F56nvehh2t0gw.text: There's not enough parking onsite for cars or butts on a Saturday night, but I'm willing to let that slide. We parked on a nearby street and managed to find a spot near our friends' table.  Then, the fun began. I asked the waitress for a glass of Jameson on the rocks. She seemed stressed, and like she was juggling a million open tabs at the time, so I told her I'd pay in cash. I meant to make it easier on her.

gxtYq0LyJfxrfuKpEo9dYQ.text: Best Irish pub I've been to in Phoenix... It even stacks up well against some of the European Irish pubs I've been to and reminded me of being back in Europe. Anyplace that can do that gets 4 stars from me as long as everything else is above average. It is... although, to be fair, the parking here looks like it could definitely pose a challenge at a "busier than Sunday afternoon" time. The service was very attentive and the food was good. I've never had corned beef on potato skins before, but now I'm wondering why everyplace doesn't do that. It's way better than bacon and provides that meaty, saltiness that skins need to survive the entire gathering. These didn't need to be dipped in sour cream and drowned in beer just to swallow the typical leathery dryness they usually take on after sitting a few minutes. YAY! The chicken tenders were almost too thick with breading, but the tasty fries made up for this shortcoming.  The local Hefe was good (albeit served with a lemon wedge and not the "politically correct" orange slice) and the "made from scratch" Marg's were decently stiff. Whenever I'm back in the neighborhood, it's good to know I have a new favorite.

bbfLvhf2b8WLg-GSP2MGXw.text: I went on a Friday night after work with 3 of my girlfriends.  It was raining, cold, and we were HUNGRY!  Got a good spot right across from the front door, very surprised.  The parking lot was parked with cars.  Must be our lucky night!  Found a table on the other side of the bar, where the music was blasting.  It was still all good!    We ordered:  Rosie's Chili Con Quezo Dip, Patrick's Irish Potato Skins, Jimky's Famous Chicken Wings Mild, Quigley's Quesadilla, Rosie's "World Famous" Pulled Pork Sandwich, Corned Beef & Cabbage, & Sweet Potato Fries.  And of course drinks!!!  Yes, our eyes are bigger than our stomaches.  The waitress warn us that it is ALOT of food.  The girls said the drinks were weak, but I only had ice tea.  All the food was great!  The service was wonderful.  She was very nice!    Loved the central location and the pub atmosphere!

R-wi_XQzIrvAIMU2m2TpqA.text: The most football-friendly bar I've been to in Phoenix. (And by football I mean soccer). They recognize that the USA vs Mexico is an event worthy of audible commentary, while still accommodating those few who have an interest in Venezuela vs. Peru! Well done! Throw in a good happy hour; host a Celtic supporters club; add a plethora of Irish knickknacks; and you've got a good recipe for a proper pub.

ltp9TOFIznEJ5eY0R_Fv5A.text: First time to this pub & it was more then I expected. I didn't get to have any of the food but everything I saw go by looked pretty good. The group of people playing traditional Irish music at the front playing was very charming. Because ot the music you feel transported to what my idea of what a pub in Ireland would be like. The band is there most nights until 10 p.m. Looking forward to a return trip & the calorie splurge.

5slaTPD9W_wkL2dB1FL0rg.text: When I was little kid growing up...  I would say to myself, "when I turn 21 I will have my first 'legal' drink there" Little did I know I would be having my first legal drink in another Irish pub 1400miles north of PHX, in a pub called Kells. I have always liked Irish pubs. Cant put my finger on why...  Rosie was great because they are always a nice amount of people. Its relaxing and invigorating all at the same time. The smoldering mixture of the band and older middle aged patrons trying to find a little bit of fun they still can squeeze out. YA! thats going to be me one day....  And like always, got to eat those fries...mmm sweet papas!  R\_  NOte: Bartender, I do one want to be a philanthropist but at this time I cant..so I will not pay for ever bodies tab...2x this has happen. Is the machine unable to separate tabs? curious.

bT-XyY-28mvehQpvsOL0Cg.text: I love this place! It is a True Irish bar with a True Irish feeling inside. Everything from the music, items on the wall, set up of the restaurant, and drinks scream Ireland. Since I was only there for a morning beer this time, I can't say anything about the food but the Guinness' hit the spot.

saiWxFZPjcur9tHY4NOyDA.text: i used to frequent this place more then 3 times a week. frequent regulars of the Thursday night cover band. "Play Dancing Barefoot" the Guinness is always served right and the wait staff is usually attentive. this was the place i would always be for St. Patty's day, New Year's Eve, Great Guinness Toast, umm what else? yea Every other Saturday Night and every Thursday and the occasional Friday or Monday.  this place today. i feel like i need to be bribed to go in. "arik, come down for a beer at Rosie's" "will it cost me anything?" lol.   the clientele just seems so much different then before. it used to be fairly mixed. serious drunks with chemical dependencies, and yuppies. now..umm younger crowd, which means amateur drunks, Irish car bombs and loud hoot'n. i honestly prefer the harder edge of True alcoholics. now with all the kids it just makes me think "i didn't realize i was so close to Tempe."  the food is average and seems to have gotten worse. the wait staff is still pretty good. quick and attentive. Megan is my favorite. always a huge smile.  in the past I've walked out of here with a $300 tab. today, I'm happy to pay under $20. i would rather save my money for better bars.  2 stars for the change i don't prefer, 4 stars for Megan!!!  I'll meet half way and give it a 3.

fyCs44rp1hYc0NQDpYSjQQ.text: this place is a mob scene and the waitresses are ALL so indifferent and wierd. I always hate ordering from a waitress here. But I love the atmosphere and they have such great beer that who cares. Im actually so used to lousy customer service in Phx that it just seems normal to me now when I go out. Last time I was here I got to park right in front of the door!

wv8a01NF46-pRxAfVWDMAg.text: Rosie's has become one of my go-to bars. It does get pretty loud on occasion, but if you go there during the weeknights, it's really chill. They have beers from 4 Peaks which I love, including my delicious Hop Knot. Their appetizers are exactly what you'd expect: huge, greasy, delicious, and making me feel guilty for days. Great drunk food, cool place, good beer...I'm definitely committed to this place.

tx7Mof1b7-rDUkkFdRPKzQ.text: This update is not because I went back to Rosie's, but to share the comment I received from my server. I really think it's in poor taste she felt the need to contact me and makes me NEVER want to give business to Rosie's ever again. In my review I relayed the events as they happened, I'm not going to sugar coat it. I still think the cost of my friends drinks should not have been charged to me and it's not that my friends are "unreliable dining compainions", it was not their fault their drinks were not charged to them and they didn't notice. The server is the one who rang up the order and made the mistake, she should own up to it, not blame my friends or get pissy with me. It's really too bad that I don't want to give my business to Rosie's because I really do like it there and I really wasn't that upset with the server, just the situation. I still stand by the fact the drinks wrongfully charged to me should not have been my responsiblity. Doesn't matter if the drinks belonged to my friends, I shouldn't have had to pay for the mistake the server made.   Here is her comment: I was your server that evening and do not appreciate that you feel servers should have to pay out of our own pockets for your friends mistakes.  We seperate checks to make things more convienent for you.  Most places do not allow split checks.  I am sorry your friends skipped out on their portion of the tab.  Maybe you should find more reliable dining companions. As for the one beer on your tab, that indeed was my mistake and if my memory serves me correctly, i quickly and kindly apologized for MY mistake and swiftly removed it from your tab without any friction. Can't wait to see you again soon.  Rosie's always tries to give a good experience to it's customers.

YkAanXnjlDboZkp1wJ5FcQ.text: Dive bar that happens to be Irish.  Plenty of people drinking light fizzy yellow beer with megadeath music playing loud overhead, and several video game machines that take quarters on the bar itself.  Sure, there's a few Irish sayings on the wall and they serve Guinness (though ours wasn't in the Guinness glasses that most Irish pubs seem to have).  Glasses weren't especially clean either as we could smell a cleaning chemical like aroma in the beer glass.  Parking was nearly full on a rainy Monday night so I fear what it would be on the weekend.  Doesn't have the same Irish vibe over at Seamus McCaffrey's.

FpHB2_lVVrF2KaZ7dLyKjA.text: This place is near my house, so we tend to go there a lot.  They have a great irish band that plays some nights.  I really like this place for drinking, but I've eaten here a few times and the food is less than mediocre.  I also don't recommend this place for St. Patty's day.  We waited in line for about 30 minutes. Paid 20 bucks to get in, and had to wait about half an hour for drinks.  It wasn't worth it.

4U845N9_oHOKh2R5twIRjw.text: A large group of us has went there after work a few times. Nice place only thing we have to complain about is the waitress was really eager to cash us out and was on the rude side the last couple times we went even tho we always tip her well. Would go again but looking for another spot that's open late during the week.

RigfVZmSm_oiZgKyZHSqJA.text: This place seems to get better every time I visit. The first time was a Friday night out with the guys. We met up for dinner and I had (and loved) the pulled pork and sweet potato fries. After dinne we got our drink on with a live band. The waitress was helpful in getting us drunk off a variety of liquors. And the shots kept on coming! It was a blast. The second time was more laid back, just grabbing a beer with a girlfriend. It was a Tuesday and the place was pretty busy. The next time me and the girlfriend showed up completely wasted and they had an Irish band playing. It was a perfect way to end our night after clubbing at the gay bar! We had a baileys nightcap and everything went dark from there. Awesome night!

KhH1uqKOUhSL3bw00eMMSg.text: So, I know that there are tons of reviews on this great little Irish Pub, but after driving by it a million times, I finally got to go in...it was a Monday, but a good experience none the less.  I enjoyed the atmosphere and the beer was good.  I had the spinach artichoke dip and it was quite tastey although a little watery for my tastes.  I don't think Monday is the best way to judge a good Irish pub, but it reminded me of the pubs I went to when I was in Ireland.  I hope I can convince someone to go back with me soon!

1JHDNPa4aEbJnMXHdMwxtg.text: This is my favorite bar in North Phoenix because it's a True "local," just like the ones I found living in Ireland. The staff is great, though colorful, the atmosphere is top notch, music is great though loud and the drinks.. delicious! Sure, it's not for everyone.. this isn't a Scottsdale skank bar or West Valley sprawl corporate bar. It's authentic. It's Phoenix.. or a weird Irish version of it.

GI28KbnO1gAYRq7bCPj-qQ.text: Great pub with a genuine and fun Celtic feel. Like any good Irishman I like space to roam around - this place has ample space and seating (upstairs and downstairs patio). The beers here are great, selection is great, as is the live Irish music. Waiting staff was friendly and swift with food and drinks. Last time I was in, about a week ago, there was a fight on the entrance patio. Intense. One guy got a broken nose, the other a bloody leg from a bottle cut. The cops were called and broke the whole thing up. Everyone else on the patio just hanging out, watching - entertainment, I guess. Aside from that, it was a good night though. I'll be back again.

vx8pb753DEKqvFTTXgxVKw.text: great beer selection great live music great atmosphere I used to live across the street and nightcap it here everynight. there is always something to be had at rosie's.

RgevlDxjdI_zjk5t4r1riQ.text: Watch where you sit if you want to have a conversation. The barkeep will blast the music even if you complain it's so loud it's causing pain. The place also acoustically amplifies the already loud drunk customers. Noise aside, the food and service are great. The beer is just the right temperature, too. Delicious burgers, and Rosie is the best, addressing everyone as 'love."

C59j9ew2T_qNy9a2Lu8fug.text: Been there once and it was pretty solid.  Hard to screw up beer and fried appetizers though :)  Atmosphere is pretty good and the staff is great.

dGAoOw0lDyP6MMKIObXJEw.text: Despite driving by a million times, last Saturday was my first visit to Rosie's. Definitely a no BS establishment, which is what I love most. A place to sit, a good beer, an attentive waitress, and great company is all I need in life- Rosie's accommodated that perfectly.

bfzQndt895gBiJScjPSg5g.text: My favorite place in Phoenix to grab a Perfect Pint. I think Guinness in an Irish pub just tastes better. And at Rosie's its even better thanks to the lively pub. My friends and I go come here whenever possible, its always a great time with great friends, great drink, and at a great place. Rosie's is that place where you always bump into someone you know. It makes this city seem just a little bit smaller. If you get there early enough for dinner, try the fish and chips, it's pretty tasty. But really, Guinness is a meal unto itself. Just grab a booth, sit back, and enjoy the night.

BOYQBDUwFyGbaXruWCHXTA.text: Oh boy was I excited when I first walked into Rosie McCaffrey's.  An Irish pub right down the street?  This place was a godsend disguised as a local drunken hotspot.  Apparently, it wasn't disguised at all.  It really is just a local drunken hotspot.  I've been a moderate patron of Rosies for the past few months now, and while this is my usual watering hole of choice, there are a few things that need to be said about it.  First of all, the beer selection is good.  It isn't Yardhouse by a longshot, but the choices are varied for different tastes and income brackets.  The food is good for bar fare.  I felt much like a Irish local grazing the fields of greasy confections, I could literally feel my alcohol tolerance increasing with each bite.  The service is good, but prepare to wait if the place fills up (which it does) and you'll get looked over if you don't have cleavage (which I don't) but it helps if you're on a first name basis with the staff (which I am).  The music is varied, which is nice.  On the nights where live music is playing, you'll get a spattering of Irish folk music or recent covers.  I'm a fan of a few bands that play there, but to be completely honest, there have only been a few occasions where I've found my toes tapping.  But it's lively and fun, pleasant to listen to while you inebriate yourself.  You'll find a wide range of characters that frequent Rosies, though.  From the bar rats, greased woman hunters, drunken floozies, haughty better-than-alls and down home boys, there is never a lack of people to talk to.  I can't guarantee a good experience, but who can?  But I wouldn't worry, if you're using the place as you should, you won't remember tomorrow morning anyway.  No matter it's flaws, Rosie McCaffery's is worth a visit at least.  Grab a bite, take a shot of Irish courage and mix it up with a stranger.  If you see a fellow standing to the side, people watching with a silent amused smirk, come and say hello.  I probably won't bite.

m2_J8xigPAnS80Q0QRDOpg.text: First time to the Irish Pub, we went on a rainy friday night and actually found parking and a table, I think that's pretty uncommon for Rosies in a good way.  My drink was weak but the food was pretty good!  Our server was great, very patient and also since our eyes were bigger than our stomachs, warned us about the portions, that was very kind of her.  Very comfortable atmosphere and a great centrally located pub/restaurant.

TpTLPOJ1fsuVamFmssgFRA.text: I love Rosie's. I was so happy to find it when I first moved to Phoenix three years ago because stepping inside felt familiar, like the dozens of authentic Irish pubs in Boston where I lived for nearly 8 years prior. The bartenders are friendly, the live music is great, and the atmosphere is relaxed and casual with that neighborhood bar feel. Highly recommended for the homesick Bostonians!

m86uuJHzyF11bwb61W3niA.text: Since I live in the east Valley and work in Central Phoenix, I need a few good watering holes to kill time while the traffic clears. Rosie's is one of those places that has a local watering hole feel. Plus they have good beer, good happy stuff and everyone in there from the bartenders to the people are cool.

RHTjpQO0ftv2FOVd7jujUw.text: Very awesome little Irish pub.  The food is great, depending on who is there and picks it, the music is good.  Staff is courteous, and efficient.  For a first time in this place I'm fairly certain this may be a place I frequent more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fairly large bar area, with additonal eating booths all over.  This place us awesome!

TJNOtb5lnrP7wQEsDUj7VQ.text: We had fish and chips and the Shepard's pie, both were outstanding as well as the service. We look forward to returning.

lTpgnLSe0bEPW_Kahoav-w.text: Three words: Legit Irish pub.  None of this nonsense where they place Guinness ads everywhere and make vague references to Dublin on some sign. But a great bar, with a wall of whiskey and the best British beers. Seriously, almost every whiskey I can think of is on their shelf, and all YOU have to do is decide if you're hardcore enough for straight shots or car bombs. With a coke, you say? Wuss.  Anyways, I saw some people ordering food (I was just here to drink) and it looked pretty good. I'll be back!

TU8RxcMJKwE6cuWypHjjew.text: I had the pastrami reuben, it was super delicious. The Nachos are definitely a must have as well!  It has a great atmosphere and the service was perfect! Can't wait to go again!

80i28L6EPzKZy2UfMODFLg.text: Extra extra, read all about it. Greetin's, salutations. Peace to the nations. Crack the bottle, rev the throttle . Top 'o The Mornin To Ya.  This is a small pub with an extra friendly staff and performers.  I'm not a leprechaun but when I have a Guinness I sure do step up and get it on. The house is notorious for the stout drinks, rowdy blokes, and loud traditional live music.   Cheers to the luck o' the Irish.

7EZuTZHpnQRJHV-EAIht0A.text: Fantastic food happy hour specials and their food is delicious. I don't usually like curry much but their curry fries are amazing!  Shepherd's pie is really good too!  Cool pub vibe and the servers are always nice. Live music on weekends is fun too!

smvY0l7TH8KdQ4IuY35Ghg.text: Stopped in for a drink on a Friday afternoon, unfortunately I wasn't a big fan. There was a faint mildew smell coming from behind the bar, so the cleanliness needs some work. Bartenders were not very friendly. The overall layout of the place seemed a little odd, uninviting and not the kind of place that I'd like to spend time. I wanted to like it, but just couldn't.

N07yNSrgC169nkPiQJvM1A.text: It's ok, and the prices are ok. But the only things that I have consistently liked here are the Irish Car Bombs, the giant pretzels(...mmmm sodiyummy...(sodium + yummy...you know?) and beer-cheesy!) and the servers are more-or-less on the ball 100% of the time.  Anywho, I know they've been going through a couple of staffing issues with their cook(s) so I will refrain from being too bummed out on the food...PLUS it was a Monday night so I'll give 'em the benefit of the doubt.   We ordered the Foley's Sampler, the chicken fingers were AWESOME, the wings were really decent too, but I could've done without ANY of the rest of it.   Next time I'll see about ordering some traditional Irish fare and make a real assessment. Yes, I'll be back. But I'm not making any other excuses for y'all, dammit.

92YLm6YP970DtL3pvQHHIQ.text: Definitely a LEGIT trush irish pub. Been to that bar a few times and everytime I had nothing negative to say about Rosie's. Really great selection of draft beers which is  always a plus in any bar I plan on visiting. My only issue is being a west valley guy, it can be a little bit of a drive to the central phoenix area. My advice for anyone coming the west valley or anywhere else were this could be a little out of their way, defintely designate a DD!  So my first experience of Rosie's came from a  very good friend told me about this Irish pub not too long ago, and since then this family-operated establishment has been one of my new favorite bars. The atmosphere is dim lit, not too loud, and equipped with several TVs for anyone that wants to watch a european soccer game.   I spent the last St. Patrick's day @ Rosie's and had a blast!!!! Cover charge was no shocker, but still reasonable, and absolutely justifiable if you have ever been there before. Every corner of the whole place was filled with live music, great people, and of course good irish whiskey! Both indoor and outdoor bands were playing all types of music. I reccomend anyone in the area to visit Rosie McCaffrey's, but just be on the lookout that parking cansometimes be a pain, so keep an eye out for a n empty spot!

GgdL_ZGuOEYLCCteDvmiew.text: Never again will we go here. We are fairly sure we got FOOD POISONING from eating here. A friend of ours insisted we had to go for the fish and chips: place was pretty empty when we arrived, and we were told to seat ourselves. The appetizers were pretty good- pizza mozzarella sticks.   I don't like fried fish, so I had a chicken sandwich, which had mayo. My husband had the fried fish, as well as coleslaw(made with mayo), which no one else in our party ate. 2-4 hours later, we both started feeling quite ill- agonizingly painful stomach cramps, nausea, and several other symptoms I won't go into here. The symptoms lasted for 4 days. Bottom line, avoid anything with mayo.  We certainly will not return.

kIGnQOm_E9zQ6TRz5GoZDA.text: Great bar! Food is excellent! One of the last places you can get a guiness poured properly. Atmosphere is great. Service is off and on. This place is quickly becoming a gay bar, not that that's bad IDGAF. Just noting that.

M-jEgMGGr3Dv-Zmb-cwrZg.text: I have always loved this place, but went there for lunch today with coworkers and the staff said that they changed their menu...well not for the better in my opinion. My "McCaffrey's Burger" was super dry and super salty. I asked for a "medium" and got a "well done", almost burnt burger. I definitely expected more being that the burger cost $14! My friend got the "Margarita Flatbread", but that came out about 10-15 min after everyone got their food, it was obvious that our sever forgot to ring in the item. When it finally came out it wasn't a flatbread at all, but a 12" pizza (a pizza that really only had sauce on it with circles of cheese and looked like a 5 year old made it). Was planning on spending St. Patty's Day here, but I'll start looking for alternatives now.

ISkqiokNQpwuGmJwzLKTOg.text: Stopped in last Friday night on the way home after watching a disappointing Diamondbacks loss. A band called the Sea Merchants was playing some great rowdy Irish music so we took a seat at the bar. Service was prompt and the selection of craft beers was very good. We had only planned on staying for one (yeah right) but we met some friendly patrons on the patio and as a result stayed much longer than anticipated. The patio is not fancy and faces Camelback Road. The interior feels very Irish Pub like to me. Most impressive was the ambiance and the friendliness in the place. It seems like a great neighborhood bar. Wish it was in my neighborhood! In any case, I will be stopping in again whether the DBacks lose or not.

85gVftliMsrPlFasyTdTaw.text: Wow, what a letdown!  All the great reviews and I was expecting fish and chips on par with Tim Finnegans or Fibber Magees. Pros:  - Quick service - Good beers on tap - Good customer service - lots of seating  Cons - Insanely loud when bands are playing - food - older crowd - never attractive women

xELKSWmtFZ3F0YCcoiOquw.text: Outside seems a bit drab and dark, but inside improves the experience with authentic looking decor  Lots of friendly people and staff very welcoming! Overall good pub fare, although the appetizers choices and sizes could use some help.  Potato skins were the best! Good recommendations from server for food. Meal was Delicious Ruben burger! Bed of both worlds!  My daughter did not care for her mac and cheese so they sweetly offered to to substitute for something else.  I did not know this at the time but I ended up having to pay for the more expensive plate instead of her meal?  Really? Hmmm  Well, very tasty overall and they threw in my son's birthday dessert so that was kind. Average value with good flavors and service was excellent!  Love the Irish music until the NFL game came on then it was just another eatery.  Go on a non-major sport event night and you will love it all! Going again soon! Yum.

vyWGDHDkCj4Skv0hLrjYOg.text: You would think one of the higher rated Irish bars would be able to handle the crowd the night before St Patricks Day. You'd be wrong.  Standing room only and they only have 2 people behind the bar! So not every table gets good service.  I tried standing by the bar but just got ignored.  If you are not at a booth or the. Ar you're out of luck.  It is up to you to flag down a waitress.  After that she checked on us regularly.  The bar was very crowded as usual for a Saturday night and we were sitting in a location where we got bumped quite a bit but luckily nobody spilled beer on us. aJdtLnCx-qPJ4UnDi3ZXkA.text: A very good well known Irish Restaurant has gone down hill.  Their service and food is not what it used to be.  Came here for the their famous Corn Beef and Cabbage and Shepherds Pie. i_teZmzgDULANG8rWkM5pg.text: I love this spot love the food love the drinks and love the bartenders. Great place to wined down the night, very relaxed... Very low key my #1 spot to come to alone or with company. Fish and chips is the best love the sliders love the burgers.

HDYBGdooUzxBG3QPAX-7OQ.text: I used to love this place. Now they have a new menu and all the good stuff is gone. They sell flatbread pizzas now, at an Irish pub. Where did the corned beef tacos and meatloaf sandwich and Guinness boxty go? They were really good and the reason I went there. I tried the new menu. I had the shephards pie. It was ok. But waaay too much celery, that wasn't cooked very well. Shephards pie is about meat and potatoes, not crunchy celery in every bite. And at $14 for a pie the size of a hubcap, too large and too expensive on a lunch menu. I don't think I will be going back.

XQvjiCdwnjkKZZmCTS_KDw.text: I've visited Rosie McCaffrey's twice. This last time for lunch.The place was rather empty during the lunch hour. I brought my kids for lunch with me since it was during their Spring Break and thought they would enjoy a little pub lunch. The restaurant is in a convenient location so I thought why not? I enjoy the decor of the restaurant although it is a bit dark. They just updated their new menu. Their old menu was still online. I noticed that they increased pricing and they also made their menu a bit more generic and less Irish-style cuisine.  After placing our order, we proceeded to wait over 30 minutes which was unacceptable.  The server was kind enough to change the TV programming for us but waiting over 30 minutes with kids doesn't work. My kids ordered the mac and cheese from the kids menu and the meal for $6 was not a good value. It tasted fine but my 11 year old son proceeded to polish it off in 2 minutes. And he's a small kid! I order the strawberry and spinach salad.  This was pretty decent salad although for $11, it was a pretty small salad.    I liked the idea of having a pub lunch at an Irish restaurant but I'm afraid there are better choices that offer authentic and better food, a livelier setting, and more reasonable pricing. Kind of disappointing since it is a convenient location.

78nlnwRM1gH0M3TI66snEg.text: One of my favorite if not my favorite Irish bar in Phoenix!  I've been to Rosie's several times and never had a bad experience here.  I just wish I lived closer to here!    We recently came for a Guinness this past Saturday night.  Had a band playing on stage and we grabbed a seat at the bar.  Had quick service, but I would bet that was because there really wasn't that many people here.  But I've been here when it was so packed I could barley move.  We ended up going up to the top level, didn't know but we crashed a private party, but everyone was very cool and ended up having good conversation with total strangers.  Had a lot of fun finishing my Guinness while up on the upstairs patio and a great Feb Phx night.    Overall I would recommend Rosie's to anyone in Phoenix that is looking for an authentic Irish bar experience.

Tried the Irish Mac & Cheese, Irish potato skins, and also the fish and chip/ Pricing seem pretty good and enjoyed the food. Both times I was with good company and didn't pay attention to wait time, but didn't seem so bad.

tLzHs2auBkdOhE2xpX0dfQ.text: Great place, staff was friendly, atmosphere was cool. A bunch of fans there for euro 2016 made watching the game fun. Menu is ecclectic, including pizza, so you dont have to feel like you have to have bangers and mash. I ordered some bacon, cheese fries that were really good.

xxQPSudDmoNlLWfp_jtBiw.text: My last visit to RM was one of the most unpleasant experiences I've had at a local venue. I brought a group of friends from out of town to grab some drinks.   We were greeted at the front door by an odor that smelled like raw sewage. To get away from it we migrated to the stage-end of the bar which was empty but the live music was obnoxiously loud.   So we continued to the unheated patio area where we were immediately greeted by two local transients who asked us for cigarettes. We don't smoke and told them so. We grabbed a table and were happy to be seated and clear of the hazards.   Right then an RM staff member entered the patio area and politely asked the transient fellows to move on. They came to an agreement that if he provided them both with cigarettes, they would leave. Guess who the Staff member came over to ask? Seriously. We said no again.  A waiter then came out and took drink orders but informed our 23 year-old Chinese friend in a very cold and apathetic tone that she would not be able to order alcoholic beverages at RM since they would not, out of preference, recognize either of her 2 forms of identification from China.   Our friend was confused since she had ordered drinks at several venues in town before without issue. There was no explanation provided. We apologized to our friend and ensured her that this is not how most venues in the United States treat visitors.   About 10 minutes after drinks were served we were asked to leave the pub since it was 10 pm and our 23 year-old friend could not prove she was 21. She apologized to the group emphatically for causing a scene. We felt horribly for her and for the fact that our waiter took and placed our orders minutes before she knew we would be asked to leave.

KjzMKy0Pg5JFpF0IEqzhdA.text: I went back here last weekend and realized I have never reviewed one of my fave hot wing spots. It's a nice Irish bar, it seems to be hurting lately for some reason. I noticed they do Groupon now. Good time to check it out. We had corned beef n cabbage and of course, their FREAKING HOT WINGS. I had forgotten just how hot they are. The average hot wing eater should choose medium. They are supposedly marinated in Guinness. I don't know about that. But the hot sauce is thick and flavorful, really dark and hot. Perfect thing to burn your face off with after you get tanked on beer. I have had Shepherds Pie here, sandwiches, never anything that wasn't good. I noticed they were understaffed last week.  So services was so-so. But they have a solid staff that hasn't changed much in years and people are always having fun at the large horseshoe shaped bar. I have had a few interesting times here, usually something weird going on around you to listen in on. If that's your thing. I have never gotten out cheap but never broke either, I wish I still lived close by so I could go more often. Used to be my weekly run, not so now.

-MiU1Z4FKMkk1cSLcsFTwg.text: Favorite local spot that feels like "home." Always great service and consistently great meals. I love the Mac n cheese, it's my guilty pleasure... Brunch is also great on Sunday's.

photos.caption: Photo of Rosie McCaffrey's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fries and Mac n cheese

Needless to say, I have been here quite often and have never had a bad meal. SmZRgF5C4q4ZNtTJ8FxTIw.text: Rosie's is mine and my sister's go to beer place. It is conveniently close and just very cozy. I always get the Magner's Cider which is so damn delicious, and Wenesday's live performer is always so delightful to listen to.

RNYJx1r4IHI7GKCL0pKm0g.text: Great, divey Irish pub with live music and good beer on tap.  The beer menu is not as extensive as some places, but the laidback crowd, and cool atmosphere make up for that flaw.  We gathered here with a group of friends and had a great time and a lot of booze and our tab was super cheap.  Parking is a little scarce, but once you find a spot and step inside you can kick your feet up and have a jolly good time.  Cheers.  Only complaint is that there is not enough room by the band.
